unnormalised: Alright guys, let's talk numbers! Specifically, let's break down the latest financial report from Infosys. Forget all that corporate jargon, we're going to keep it real and see what those figures actually mean for us desis.
normalised: Alright guys, let's talk numbers! Specifically, let's break down the latest financial report from I-N-F-O-S-Y-S. Forget all that corporate jargon, we're going to keep it real and see what those figures actually mean for us desis.

unnormalised: First off, revenue clocked in at ₹37,335 crore. Now, that's a hefty amount! It's like saying Ambani finds a ₹500 note on the street – still makes a difference, right? Jokes aside, that's a big number, but the growth year-on-year isn't as explosive as some might've hoped for. We’re talking something around 11% (YoY).
normalised: First off, revenue clocked in at rupee thirty seven thousand three hundred and thirty five crore. Now, that's a hefty amount! It's like saying Ambani finds a rupee five hundred note on the street – still makes a difference, right? Jokes aside, that's a big number, but the growth year on year isn't as explosive as some might've hoped for. We’re talking something around eleven percent year on year.

unnormalised: Then there’s profit after tax (PAT), which came in at ₹6,021 crore. Not bad, not bad at all. It's still lower than projected. Remember that time your chacha promised you ₹5000 for scoring good marks, but only gave you ₹3000? Kinda like that, expectations weren't quite met.
normalised: Then there’s profit after tax, which came in at rupee six thousand and twenty one crore. Not bad, not bad at all. It's still lower than projected. Remember that time your chacha promised you rupee five thousand for scoring good marks, but only gave you rupee three thousand? Kinda like that, expectations weren't quite met.

unnormalised: Now, operating margins - this is where things get interesting. They’re sitting at 21.5%. That might sound impressive, but it's a bit down compared to last quarter. Companies like TCS are also in the game. Imagine trying to win the Gilli Danda competition in your mohalla when Sharmaji's kid is also a pro - that's the level of competition these guys are facing.
normalised: Now, operating margins - this is where things get interesting. They’re sitting at twenty one point five percent. That might sound impressive, but it's a bit down compared to last quarter. Companies like T-C-S are also in the game. Imagine trying to win the Gilli Danda competition in your mohalla when Sharmaji's kid is also a pro - that's the level of competition these guys are facing.

unnormalised: The report also highlights some key wins in the banking and financial services sector. Think of it as landing a big project worth $5 million. It's going to look good on the CV and boosts the company’s long-term health.
normalised: The report also highlights some key wins in the banking and financial services sector. Think of it as landing a big project worth dollar five million. It's going to look good on the C-V and boosts the company’s long-term health.

unnormalised: For all you investors out there, here's the tea: Infosys is predicting revenue growth of between 13% to 16% for the next fiscal year. Now, that’s a forecast, not a guarantee. Take it with a pinch of namak.
normalised: For all you investors out there, here's the tea: I-N-F-O-S-Y-S is predicting revenue growth of between thirteen percent to sixteen percent for the next fiscal year. Now, that’s a forecast, not a guarantee. Take it with a pinch of namak.

unnormalised: On a slightly different note, employee attrition is a concern. It’s hovering around 25.2%. That means a bunch of people are leaving. It's like when half your cricket team decides to ditch you right before the final match against Sector 15! Can be a real headache for projects and deadlines.
normalised: On a slightly different note, employee attrition is a concern. It’s hovering around twenty five point two percent. That means a bunch of people are leaving. It's like when half your cricket team decides to ditch you right before the final match against Sector fifteen! Can be a real headache for projects and deadlines.

unnormalised: Overall, the financial report paints a picture of a company that's still growing, but facing some headwinds. It's not a runaway success story, but it's definitely not a disaster either. A good, solid performer navigating a challenging market. Just like your average Indian uncle trying to run a small business. Keeping it steady, keeping it real.
normalised: Overall, the financial report paints a picture of a company that's still growing, but facing some headwinds. It's not a runaway success story, but it's definitely not a disaster either. A good, solid performer navigating a challenging market. Just like your average Indian uncle trying to run a small business. Keeping it steady, keeping it real.
